Package com.esplibrary.client

Class ESPValentineClient

java.lang.Object
com.esplibrary.client.ESPValentineClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
IESPClient
public class ESPValentineClient extends Object implements IESPClient
Concrete implementation of the ESP Client interface.

    • connect

      public boolean connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice v1Device, ConnectionType connType, @Nullable ConnectionListener listener)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Attempts to make a connection with device.

      If Bluetooth isn't supported, or an invalid connection type, of attempting to connect with a LE device without device support, this method immediately returns false and no connection is attempted.

      Specified by:
      connect in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      v1Device - Device to connect
      connType - Bluetooth type of device
      listener - Listener that will be invoked when connection events occur.
      Returns:
      True if a connection is attempted.

    • readConnectedDeviceRSSI

      public boolean readConnectedDeviceRSSI(@NonNull RSSICallback callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Asynchronously reads the connected remote BLE devices RSSI and invokes callback once the value has been read.
      Specified by:
      readConnectedDeviceRSSI in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      callback - the callback that will be invoked with the read back RSSI value.

      Note: Regardless of the calling thread callback will always be invoked on main (UI) thread.
      Returns:
      True if an Asynchronously read has taken place. If false is returned, check the error log (Logcat Lvl. "Error") output for a hint as to why the call failed.

    • requestWriteUserBytes

      public void requestWriteUserBytes(byte[] userBytes, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request to update the user configuration @link UserSettings settings} inside the V1.

      Note: This operation makes no guarantee that the V1's settings have been successfully updated with the provided user bytes, simply that the packet was sent and no errors were received.
      Specified by:
      requestWriteUserBytes in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      userBytes - The new settings to update the V1's settings.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the userBytes are sent or if an error occurs.

      Specified by:
      requestWriteUserBytes in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      device - The target device
      userBytes - The new settings to update the V1's settings.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the userBytes are sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestDefaultSweeps

      public void requestDefaultSweeps(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request that the V1 reset all custom sweep definitions back to their default. When operating in Euro Mode, this will change the display from 'C' to 'U' or 'c' to 'u' depending on the user's mode selection.

      Note: This operation makes no guarantee that the V1's sweeps have been reset simply that the packet was sent and no errors were received. (see IESPClient.requestAllSweepDefinitions(ESPRequestedDataListener))
      Specified by:
      requestDefaultSweeps in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the default sweeps packet is sent or if an error occurs.

    • requestDefaultSweepDefinitions

      public void requestDefaultSweepDefinitions(ESPRequestedDataListener<List<SweepDefinition>> callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request all default custom sweep definitions.
      Specified by:
      requestDefaultSweepDefinitions in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      callback - The ESPRequestedDataListener that will be invoked when all sweeps are received or an error occurs.

    • requestSweepData

      Description copied from interface: IESPClient

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      requestOverrideThumbwheelToAuto in interface IESPClient

    • requestWriteSweepDefinitions

      public void requestWriteSweepDefinitions(List<SweepDefinition> sweeps, ESPRequestedDataListener<Integer> callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request for the V1 to use the List of custom sweeps instead of the factory sweeps when in Euro Mode.

      The number of supported sweeps is V1 version specific and can be obtained using IESPClient.requestMaxSweepIndex(ESPRequestedDataListener). The valid sweep sections can be read using IESPClient.requestSweepSections(ESPRequestedDataListener). If a sweep defintion is invalid, such as when a sweep definition crosses a sweep range boundary, the sweep will not be used. Refer to the Custom Sweep range for more details.

      Specified by:
      requestWriteSweepDefinitions in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      sweeps - List of custom sweeps the V1 should use.
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when all sweeps have been written or if an error occurs.
        Callback accepts an integer as it's first param. This integer value is the sweep write result.
      • 0 == Sweep Write Successful.
      • Any Other Value equals the number of the first sweep with invalid parameters. (The error number returned will be the sweep index + 1, where sweep index is the index from the IESPClient.requestWriteSweepDefinitions(List, ESPRequestedDataListener)).

    • requestMute

      public void requestMute(boolean mute, ESPRequestListener callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request to mute all alerts in the V1. The results of this packet can be verified using the InfDisplayData.getAuxData(). The V1 treats this packet as a mute button press. Therefore, this command is only in effect until all alerts are no longer being tracked byvthe V1.

      Note: The requestMute(false) will not unmute a laser alert
      Specified by:
      requestMute in interface IESPClient
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when the V1's has been muted/unmuted or if an error occurs.

    • requestStartAlertData

      public void requestStartAlertData(ESPRequestListener callback)
      Description copied from interface: IESPClient
      Request to receive information on all alerts being displayed on the V1's front panel.

      Alert information is represented by AlertData. Registering a ESPClientListener allows you to receive individual alerts by implementing ESPClientListener.onPacketReceived(ESPPacket). To receive a full alert table, implement ESPClientListener.onAlertTableReceived(List).

      Specified by:
      requestStartAlertData in interface IESPClient
      Parameters:
      callback - The callback that will be invoked when alert information has started to be received or if an error occurs.
